alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Elmore; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:27PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Autauga, southwestern Elmore, northeastern Lowndes and western Montgomery Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 327 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dannelly Field, or 10 miles southwest of Montgomery, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Prattville, Millbrook, Hayneville, Pike Road, Coosada, Autaugaville, White Hall, Lowndesboro, Booth, Montgomery Zoo, Boylston, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Autauga County Airport, Woodcrest, Maxwell Air Force Base, Snowdoun, Davenport, Pintlala and Hunter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
